1.text: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor, if you have struck hands in pledge with a stranger,

2.text: if you have been trapped by the words of your lips, ensnared by the words of your mouth,

3.text: then do this, my son, to free yourself, for you have fallen into your neighbor’s hands: Go, humble yourself, and press your plea with your neighbor.

4.text: Allow no sleep to your eyes or slumber to your eyelids.

5.text: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler.

6.text: Walk in the manner of the ant, O slacker; observe its ways and become wise.

7.text: Without a commander, without an overseer or ruler,

8.text: it prepares its provisions in summer; it gathers its food at harvest.

9.text: How long will you lie there, O slacker? When will you get up from your sleep?

10.text: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,

11.text: and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and need like a bandit.

12.text: A worthless person, a wicked man, walks with a perverse mouth,

13.text: winking his eyes, speaking with his feet, and pointing with his fingers.

14.text: With deceit in his heart he devises evil; he continually sows discord.

15.text: Therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly; in an instant he will be shattered beyond recovery.

16.text: There are six things that the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to Him:

17.text: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,

18.text: a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that run swiftly to evil,

19.text: a false witness who gives false testimony, and one who stirs up discord among brothers.

20.text: My son, keep your father’s commandment, and do not forsake your mother’s teaching.

21.text: Bind them always upon your heart; tie them around your neck.

22.text: When you walk, they will guide you; when you lie down, they will watch over you; when you awake, they will speak to you.

23.text: For this commandment is a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the reproofs of discipline are the way to life,

24.text: to keep you from the evil woman, from the smooth tongue of the adulteress.

25.text: Do not lust in your heart for her beauty or let her captivate you with her eyes.

26.text: For the levy of the prostitute is poverty, and the adulteress preys upon your very life.

27.text: Can a man embrace fire and his clothes not be burned?

28.text: Can a man walk on hot coals without scorching his feet?

29.text: So is he who sleeps with another man’s wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished.

30.text: Men do not despise the thief if he steals to satisfy his hunger.

31.text: Yet if caught, he must pay sevenfold; he must give up all the wealth of his house.

32.text: He who commits adultery lacks judgment; whoever does so destroys himself.

33.text: Wounds and dishonor will befall him, and his reproach will never be wiped away.

34.text: For jealousy enrages a husband, and he will show no mercy in the day of vengeance.

35.text: He will not be appeased by any ransom, or persuaded by lavish gifts.
